data.title: The life and times of Ariel Sharon
data.meta_description: The life and times of Ariel Sharon
data.text:
Feb. 26, 1928: Sharon is born to Russian immigrants in farming community of Kfar Malal north of Tel Aviv.

1948: Having joined Jewish guerrillas at age 14 in war against British rule in Palestine, Sharon serves with distinction in Israel’s war of independence and is severely wounded in battle.

1953: As head of Unit 101, his forces carry out reprisals for Palestinian attacks. After the slaying of an Israeli woman and her two children, Sharon’s troops blow up more than 40 houses in Qibya, a village in the Jordan-ruled West Bank.

1967: E He receives praise for command of an armored division in Israel’s “Six-Day War,” in which Israel captures West Bank, Gaza Strip, Golan Heights and Sinai Peninsula.

1973: F He is elected to parliament on the Likud ticket.

1974: He resigns from Parliament.

1975: He is appointed by Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin as an adviser on security affairs.

1977: Likud wins the election and is joined by Sharon, who has been elected to parliament on a separate ticket.

April 25, 1982: F As defense minister, he overrides resistance from Jewish settlers in Yamit settlement during Israeli withdrawal from Sinai Peninsula and has their homes bulldozed to rubble.

Sept. 16-18, 1982: He loses his job as defense minister after an Israeli-allied Christian militia kills hundreds of Palestinians at refugee camps in Beirut, sparking international outrage.

Sept. 28, 2000: As opposition leader, Sharon visits Jerusalem’s Temple Mount to emphasize Israel’s claim of sovereignty. Muslims, who call site the Noble Sanctuary, erupt in violence.

Feb. 6, 2001: F In midst of a political crisis, he wins a landslide victory over Ehud Barak in the election for prime minister.

Feb. 8, 2005: He announces, with Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, a cease-fire in Palestinian uprising.Jan. 4, 2006: On eve of a scheduled heart procedure, he suffers massive stroke and falls into coma.

Jan. 11, 2014: He dies at age 85.
